Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is thick and partially grey in section, the exterior is elaborated with two bands of ribbing and very faint traces of a number of Coptic characters written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393320) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393320)
